title: 104_hr1619
content: The Act is titled the "National Senior Citizens Pet Ownership Protection Act" and it amends Section 227 of the Housing and Urban-Rural Recovery Act of 1983 regarding pet ownership by elderly and disabled families in federally assisted rental housing. The "National Senior Citizens Pet Ownership Protection Act" amends Section 227 of the Housing and Urban-Rural Recovery Act of 1983 to allow elderly families in federally assisted rental housing to own common household pets without restrictions. The "National Senior Citizens Pet Ownership Protection Act" allows elderly families in federally assisted rental housing to own common household pets without restrictions, and prohibits discrimination based on pet ownership. Regulations will be issued by the Secretaries of Housing and Urban Development and Agriculture to ensure compliance. The Secretaries of Housing and Urban Development and Agriculture will issue regulations to ensure compliance with provisions for federally assisted rental housing, including guidelines for pet ownership by tenants. The Secretaries of Housing and Urban Development and Agriculture will issue regulations for federally assisted rental housing, including rules for pet ownership by tenants such as pet size, financial obligations, and standards of care. The regulations also include the authority to remove pets and definitions for elderly and disabled families. The term 'federally assisted rental housing for the elderly or disabled' refers to rental housing projects assisted under specific housing acts and designated for elderly or disabled families. The term 'other federally assisted rental housing' includes various types of housing such as public housing projects, housing with project-based assistance under section 8, housing financed by loans insured under the National Housing Act, and housing insured or assisted by HUD or a State under section 236. The term 'other federally assisted rental housing' includes housing projects assisted under section 8(b)(2) of the United States Housing Act of 1937, rental housing projects assisted under title V of the Housing Act of 1949, and housing constructed or substantially rehabilitated under section 236 of the National Housing Act. SEC. 3. REGULATIONS AND EFFECTIVE DATE. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development and the Secretary of Agriculture must issue regulations within 12 months to implement section 227 of the Housing and Urban-Rural Recovery Act of 1983. The effective date of the amended section 227 will be either when the regulations are issued or after 18 months from the enactment of the Act. Until the effective date, the provisions of section 227 will remain in place as if the amendments had not been made.
